perturbation.original_text:
Licensor shall forthwith provide to Rogers a comprehensive list (including title, length of program, license
period and availability date) of all currently available Licensed Programs. During the Term, Licensor shall use best efforts to add
newly available Licensed Programs to such list, and may periodically delete Licensed Programs from such list; provided, however,
that: (i) Licensor shall provide to Rogers at least ninety (90) days prior notice of the availability date of any Licensed Program
added to such list during the Term; (ii) Licensor shall provide to Rogers at least sixty (60) days prior notice of the deletion of any
Licensed Program from such list; and (iii) Licensor shall be responsible for any and all reasonable costs and/or losses incurred by
Rogers as a result of any deletions from such list during the Term.
perturbation.changed_text:
Licensor will endeavor to provide to Rogers a list (including title, approximate length of program, estimated license
period and general availability timeframe) of some currently available Licensed Programs. During the Term, Licensor may try to add
newly available Licensed Programs to such list, and retains the right to delete Licensed Programs from such list at any time; provided, however,
that: (i) Licensor will attempt to provide Rogers with as much notice as possible, ideally around ninety (90) days, regarding the availability date of any Licensed Program
added to such list during the Term; (ii) Licensor will try to give Rogers some notice, if feasible around sixty (60) days, before deleting any
Licensed Program from such list; and (iii) Licensor may be responsible for some costs and/or losses incurred by Rogers
as a result of any deletions from such list during the Term, as determined by Licensor's sole discretion.
perturbation.explanation: The modified text introduces ambiguities by replacing definitive obligations with vague terms like 'will endeavor,' 'approximate length,' 'estimated license period,' 'general availability timeframe,' 'may try,' 'retains the right to,' 'attempt to provide,' 'as much notice as possible,' 'ideally around,' 'try to give,' 'some notice,' 'if feasible,' and 'may be responsible...as determined by Licensor's sole discretion.' These changes make the obligations non-committal and unenforceable.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Canadian Consumer Protection Act (various provisions related to clarity and enforceability of contracts)

perturbation.original_text:
Licensor shall use commercial reasonable efforts to promote the ROD Service through Licensor’s consumer-facing advertising
and promotional mediums within the Territory. Such mediums shall include, but not be limited to: (i) television; (ii) radio; (iii) print;
(iv) Internet; and (v) event-based marketing. Licensor will deliver accurate, representative samples of all such advertising and
promotions to Rogers at least five (5) business days in advance for Rogers’ prior review and approval.
perturbation.changed_text:
Licensor may consider promoting the ROD Service through certain consumer-facing advertising
and promotional mediums within the Territory, if and when it is convenient. Such mediums could include: (i) television; (ii) radio; (iii) print;
(iv) Internet; and (v) event-based marketing. Licensor might provide some examples of possible advertising and
promotions to Rogers when practical, perhaps a few days in advance, for Rogers’ review.
perturbation.explanation: The original text imposes a 'commercial reasonable efforts' standard, a legally recognized threshold. The modified text replaces this with discretionary terms like 'may consider,' 'if and when it is convenient,' 'could include,' 'might provide,' 'some examples,' 'when practical,' and 'perhaps a few days in advance.' This makes promotion optional and the timing of providing samples unclear, creating significant ambiguity.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Competition Act (Canada) - misleading advertising and promotional practices.

perturbation.original_text:
Licensor shall reimburse Rogers for 50% of any such royalties actually paid by Rogers, calculated on a rolling basis during the Term and payable
monthly.
perturbation.changed_text:
Licensor will consider reimbursing Rogers for a portion of the royalties Rogers claims to have paid, potentially calculated over some period during the Term, possibly payable
periodically, depending on Licensor's financial situation.
perturbation.explanation: The original text creates a clear obligation for reimbursement. The modified text introduces uncertainty using terms such as 'will consider,' 'a portion of,' 'Rogers claims to have paid,' 'potentially calculated,' 'some period,' 'possibly payable,' and 'depending on Licensor's financial situation.' This transforms a fixed obligation into a discretionary one, subject to Licensor's subjective determination.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Copyright Act (Canada) - royalty obligations and tariff structures.
